questions.prompt: A conformal map preserves angles between curves.
questions.explanation: Conformal maps preserve both magnitude and orientation of angles

questions.prompt: If f is analytic at z₀ and f'(z₀) ≠ 0, then f is:
questions.explanation: Analytic with non-zero derivative implies conformal

questions.prompt: A Möbius transformation has the form:
Möbius transformations map circles to circles (including lines as circles through ∞).
questions.explanation: Möbius maps preserve the family of circles and lines (generalized circles)

questions.prompt: How many points are needed to uniquely determine a Möbius transformation?
questions.explanation: A Möbius transformation is uniquely determined by specifying the images of three points

questions.prompt: The function w = z² maps the upper half-plane to:
questions.explanation: z² doubles angles, so upper half-plane (angle π) maps to full plane (angle 2π), minus negative real axis

questions.prompt: The exponential map w = e^z sends vertical lines to:
questions.explanation: Vertical line x = c maps to |w| = e^c (circle centered at origin)

questions.prompt: The Riemann Mapping Theorem states that any simply connected domain (except ℂ) can be conformally mapped to the unit disk.
questions.explanation: This is the statement of the Riemann Mapping Theorem

questions.prompt: Schwarz-Christoffel formula maps the upper half-plane to:
questions.explanation: Schwarz-Christoffel provides explicit formula for conformal maps to polygonal regions

questions.prompt: Which physical problem is NOT typically solved using conformal mapping?
questions.explanation: Conformal mapping solves 2D Laplace equation problems: electrostatics, fluid flow, heat conduction. Quantum tunneling involves different equations

questions.prompt: A map is conformal at z₀ if it is analytic and:
questions.explanation: Conformal at z₀ requires analyticity and f'(z₀) ≠ 0

questions.prompt: Every Möbius transformation can be decomposed into compositions of translations, rotations, dilations, and inversion.
questions.explanation: Any Möbius map (az+b)/(cz+d) can be written as composition of elementary transformations

questions.prompt: The map w = 1/z sends circles not passing through the origin to:
questions.explanation: Inversion maps circles not through origin to circles

questions.prompt: Which map conformally sends the unit disk to the upper half-plane?
questions.explanation: The map w = i(1-z)/(1+z) is a standard Möbius transformation mapping disk to half-plane

questions.prompt: In fluid flow applications, conformal maps preserve:
questions.explanation: Conformal maps preserve angles and can be used to transform potential flows
